intro: Epistemma rupestre, commonly known as the rock episteme, is a flowering plant native to the rocky regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow to greenish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick stems and leaves. Epistemma rupestre is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and resilience in dry conditions.
